column4: I cannot seem to install ubuntu on my laptop. Its overheating it and casusing a thermal shutdown
its a new i3 laptop, windows works fine. even heavy operations. tried USB/CD install but it gets stuck at a  Preloader screen when i press install
jroy, I can run windows 7 fine, Visual Studio 2010 fine, Game fine. But one damn linux won't install
I don't have 10.04 iso. Guess will have to get it.
Is there any way to install it in from windows? I've got a spare drive
but the window install doesn't give me an option. it just says Demo & Install
a spare drive?
I mean partition.
right, it installs to a file on the Windows partition
you can migrate that to its own real partition later, but it's kind of the long way around
you don't have a CD/DVD/USB stick?
all set then
CD or USB it gets stuck on Preloader screen with ubuntu logo. on reboot the bios moans OVERHEATED
sweet
but your Windows install works fine?
did you try a different version?
don't have another iso right now. Will download something later then
could be some weird option you could toggle in your BIOS, too
I doubt it. Its very basic BIOS for the laptop. Nothing I think stands out. it won't even run as live cd
has a live cd ever worked with it?
technically you can copy your vmware install to empty partition space, but you'd have to possibly tweak the drivers instead of them being autoconfigured
